title: Communications Coordinator
content:
Who we are 
About Stripe
Stripe is a financial infrastructure platform for businesses. Millions of companies - from the world’s largest enterprises to the most ambitious startups - use Stripe to accept payments, grow their revenue, and accelerate new business opportunities. Our mission is to increase the GDP of the internet, and we have a staggering amount of work ahead. That means you have an unprecedented opportunity to put the global economy within everyone's reach while doing the most important work of your career.
About the team
The Communications team builds and protects Stripe’s brand and influence across the world. We’re looking for a highly organized, fast learning colleague who can make our team’s operational processes work as brilliantly as possible—and who’ll enjoy getting hands on with some of our creative work too.
We’re very proud of the deep expertise in the team—from product, corporate, and internal communications, to publishing, social media, video, and more—and are always mindful of how much more we have to learn. In Stripe Comms, you’ll work with some of the most skilled, curious, and thoughtful colleagues of your career, who’ll be equally eager to learn from you.
What you’ll do
The Communications Coordinator runs the systems and process-related projects that are critical to our effectiveness and efficiency as a team. You’ll collaborate with individuals across our global team to identify and maximize opportunities to strengthen our day to day operations, leverage metrics and reporting, and foster deeper organization across this fast-moving function. It’s an ever-changing environment, and so you’ll be comfortable contributing to projects of varying scope, leveraging data to support fast decision-making in ambiguity, and ensuring updates are shared across different stakeholders. While we’re proud of our current work, there are countless opportunities to improve—you’ll be adept at spotting these and making them happen.
Responsibilities

Oversee our email alias used by journalists and others to contact Stripe. Field and manage inbound requests, which include:

Evaluating event speaking requests 
Routing media inquiries to the right team member across different time zones
Identifying and routing user issues to the appropriate support team


Manage communications channels and tools used within our team (email aliases, Slack channels, Confluence pages, subscription and media lists, etc.)
Leverage data to measure our impact and share updates, including monthly performance snapshots, weekly round-ups of media coverage, and our global comms calendar
Support creative production on our biggest and most complex projects
Partner with Stripe’s comms leaders to scope and deliver new initiatives that will increase our effectiveness and efficiency
Act as secretariat for key team meetings, including owning the agenda and pre-reads, taking and sharing notes, and following up on actions
Work with new hires and vendors to ensure great onboarding

Who you are
We're looking for someone who meets the minimum requirements to be considered for the role. If you meet these requirements, you are encouraged to apply. The preferred qualifications are a bonus, not a requirement.
Minimum requirements

2-3 years of experience in a high-growth and/or B2B environment.
Stellar written and verbal communication skills.
An ability to juggle multiple, fast-moving, and high-priority projects at once.
Willingness to ask questions, take action, get creative, and think ahead.
Off-the-charts prioritization, project management, and organizational skills.
Interest in, and excitement about, how the media works.
Demonstrated track record as a fast and enthusiastic learner.

Preferred qualifications

Some exposure to the work of communications teams (for example, having partnered with comms teams previously)
Deep curiosity about productivity tools, including LLMs

questions.description: Stripe is currently operating in a hybrid work environment. In-office expectations for office-assigned Stripes vary by team. A remote location, in most cases, is defined as living 50 miles or more from an office location. While you would be welcome to join the office for team or business meetings when necessary, the expectation would be that you would regularly work from home rather than a Stripe office location. Stripe offices are located in Amsterdam, Bangkok, Bengaluru, Berlin, Chicago, Dubai, Dublin, Jakarta, London, Madrid, Mexico City, New York City, Paris, São Paulo, Singapore, South San Francisco, Seattle, Tokyo, and Toronto. Stripe does not cover the cost of relocating to a remote location. We encourage you to apply for roles that match the location in which you live or have intentions to live.
